Comment: Because the market acts more like a school of fish or straight-up gambling.  It's predicting how other people will react instead of reacting yourself.  It's a game and follows game theory.  That strategy is breaking down *hard* when everyone appears lost and irrational.

Author: ArcaneMercury49

Comment: Non-perishables. Dry rice and beans together can make a complete protein and serve as a great backbone. Make sure you include small amounts of a variety of different canned foods, especially canned fish and canned fruits and vegetables.  Strong sauces both provide a lot of extra calories and can help make otherwise bland food more palatable when you are eating them a lot. So include some of them and some spices.  Best to try to have at least a month of water, but water is much harder to keep stockpiled than food because you need a lot of it. So also get a collapsible rain bucket and a filtered top. This will allow you to refill your stock of water fairly regularly.  Multivitamins are a great investment for when you are forced to live off of less than ideal food, and you should also stockpile any medicine that you can which you might need. But that last part is usually quite difficult. Best to at least get a little stockpile of over the counter stuff though.
